}],"name":"invalidateNext","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"mint","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"name","outputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"","type":"string"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"rootToken","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"symbol","outputs":[{"internalType":"string","name":"","type":"string"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalSupply","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transfer","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"from","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transferFrom","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Polygon Technology (@QEDK)","details":"All child tokens are clones of this contract. Burning and minting is controlled by the ChildERC20Bridge.Upgradability:        This contract is deployed using cloneDeterministic. It is then initialized using an initialize function.        However, the contract is accessed directly, and not via a transparent upgrade proxy. As such, this contract is not upgradeable.Cloning and Initialization:        During the bootstrap process this contract is deployed on-chain.        When a token is initially mapped by the ChildERC20Bridge the deployed contract is cloned by the ChildERC20Bridge to a deterministic address.        The new ChildERC20 token is created using cloneDeterministic with the keccak256 hash of the rootToken's address as the salt.        This new ChildERC20 token is then initialized with the same name, symbol and decimals as the rootToken.        This deterministic cloning approach allows the token mapping on the root and child bridges to stay congruent.","events":{"Approval(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance."},"Initialized(uint8)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"MetaTransactionExecuted(address,address,bytes)":{"details":"Event emitted when a meta transaction is successfully executed."},"Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"bridge()":{"returns":{"_0":"address Returns the address of the Bridge"}},"burn(address,uint256)":{"details":"Can only be called by the predicate address","params":{"account":"Account of the user to burn the tokens from","amount":"Amount of tokens to burn from the account"},"returns":{"_0":"bool Returns true if function call is succesful"}},"decimals()":{"returns":{"_0":"uint8 Returns the decimals places of the token."}},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"executeMetaTransaction(address,bytes,bytes32,bytes32,uint8)":{"details":"This function allows a user to sign a transaction off-chain and have it executed by another entity.","params":{"functionSignature":"The signature of the function to be executed.","sigR":"Part of the signature data.","sigS":"Part of the signature data.","sigV":"Recovery byte of the signature.","userAddress":"The address of the user initiating the transaction."},"returns":{"_0":"returnData The bytes returned from the executed function."}},"getNonce(address)":{"params":{"user":"The address of the user."},"returns":{"nonce":"The current nonce of the user."}},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. All these values are immutable: they can only be set once during initialization."},"invalidateNext(uint256)":{"params":{"offset":"The number of nonces, from the current nonce, to invalidate."}},"mint(address,uint256)":{"details":"Can only be called by the predicate address","params":{"account":"Account of the user to mint the tokens to","amount":"Amount of tokens to mint to the account"},"returns":{"_0":"bool Returns true if function call is succesful"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"rootToken()":{"returns":{"_0":"address Returns the address of the root token"}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

returns._0: address Returns the address of the Bridge

burn(address,uint256).details: Can only be called by the predicate address

params.account: Account of the user to burn the tokens from
params.amount: Amount of tokens to burn from the account

returns._0: bool Returns true if function call is succesful
uint8 Returns the decimals places of the token.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

executeMetaTransaction(address,bytes,byt.details: This function allows a user to sign a transaction off-chain and have it executed by another entity.

params.functionSignature: The signature of the function to be executed.
params.userAddress: The address of the user initiating the transaction.

returns._0: returnData The bytes returned from the executed function.

returns.nonce: The current nonce of the user.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

initialize(address,string,string,uint8).details: Sets the values for {rootToken}, {name}, {symbol} and {decimals}. All these values are immutable: they can only be set once during initialization.

params.offset: The number of nonces, from the current nonce, to invalidate.

mint(address,uint256).details: Can only be called by the predicate address

params.account: Account of the user to mint the tokens to
params.amount: Amount of tokens to mint to the account

returns._0: bool Returns true if function call is succesful

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

returns._0: address Returns the address of the root token

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

bridge().notice: Returns bridge address controlling the child token

burn(address,uint256).notice: Burns an amount of tokens from a particular address

decimals().notice: Returns the decimals places of the token

executeMetaTransaction(address,bytes,byt.notice: Executes a meta transaction on behalf of the user.

getNonce(address).notice: Retrieves the current nonce for a user.

invalidateNext(uint256).notice: Invalidates next "offset" number of nonces for the calling address

mint(address,uint256).notice: Mints an amount of tokens to a particular address

rootToken().notice: Returns the address of the mapped token on the root chain
